title: How to Make Oven Roasted Broccoli

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 425 °F (218 °C).
steps.description: Move the rack in the oven so it's in the center.

steps.headline: Season the broccoli with olive oil and salt.
steps.description: Place 1 pound (450 g) of broccoli florets in a bowl and drizzle 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of olive oil over the florets. Sprinkle 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 g) of salt over the florets and use your hands or tongs to toss them until they're evenly coated.

steps.headline: Spread the broccoli on a sheet.
steps.description: Open the the oven door and place the baking sheet in the center of the oven. Close the oven door.

steps.headline: Roast the broccoli for 10 minutes.
steps.description: Spoon the seasoned broccoli on a rimmed baking sheet. Ensure that the florets are evenly spaced so they cook evenly. Roast the broccoli in the preheated oven for 10 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove and stir the broccoli.
steps.description: Wear oven mitts to remove the baking sheet from the oven. Use a flat spatula to stir the broccoli and return the sheet to the oven.

steps.headline: Roast the broccoli for 10 to 15 more minutes.
steps.description: Cook the broccoli until it's tender and slightly crispy on the edges. This should take another 10 to 15 minutes. You can insert a fork or knife into a floret to see if it's done. If it's tender, the fork or knife should slide right out.

steps.headline: Serve the basic roasted broccoli.
steps.description: Turn off the oven and transfer the roasted broccoli to a serving dish. Add more salt and pepper according to your taste and serve the broccoli immediately. Store leftover roasted broccoli in an airtight container. Refrigerate it for 3 to 5 days.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 425 °F (218 °C) and toast the panko for 2 minutes.
steps.description: Get out a 9 inches (23 cm) by 13 inches (33 cm) pan and spread 1/3 cup (30 g) of panko bread crumbs in it. Once the oven is hot, put the pan in and toast the breadcrumbs for 2 minutes.

steps.headline: Season the broccoli with olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper.
steps.description: Put 1 pound (450 g) of broccoli florets into a bowl and pour 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of olive oil over them. Stir in 2 cloves of minced garlic, 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 g) of kosher salt, and 1/4 teaspoon (0.5 g) of freshly ground black pepper.

steps.headline: Stir in the toasted panko.
steps.description: Wear oven mitts to hold the sheet of toasted panko. Transfer the breadcrumbs into the bowl with the seasoned broccoli and stir to combine them.

steps.headline: Transfer the broccoli to the pan.
steps.description: Spread the broccoli evenly in the same pan you used to toast the panko.

steps.headline: Roast the broccoli for 8 to 10 minutes.
steps.description: The broccoli should become tender and slightly crunchy around the edges. If the florets are still too firm, cook them for another 2 to 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Stir in the Parmesan and serve the broccoli.
steps.description: Wear oven mitts to remove the broccoli from the oven. Scatter 1/4 cup (25 g) of finely grated Parmesan or sharp Cheddar over the roasted broccoli and stir it gently before serving. Refrigerate leftover broccoli in an airtight container for 3 to 5 days.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 400 °F (204 °C) and mix the broccoli with oil, salt, and pepper.
steps.description: Put 1 ⁄2 pounds (680 g) of broccoli florets on a large rimmed baking sheet. Drizzle 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of the extra-virgin olive oil over the broccoli and sprinkle salt and pepper to taste. Use your hands or tongs to toss the broccoli with the seasonings.

steps.headline: Spread the broccoli on the sheet.
steps.description: Ensure that the broccoli florets are in a single layer with a little space in between them. Air should be able to move between the florets so they caramelize on the edges.

steps.headline: Roast the broccoli for 15 minutes.
steps.description: Open the oven door and put the baking sheet in the preheated oven. Cook the broccoli for 15 minutes so it starts to soften.

steps.headline: Stir the broccoli.
steps.description: Wear oven mitts to remove the baking sheet from the oven. Stir the broccoli with a flat spatula and put the sheet back in the oven. Stirring will ensure that the broccoli cooks evenly.

steps.headline: Roast the broccoli for 15 more minutes.
steps.description: Cook the broccoli until it's golden brown and tender when you poke it with a fork. If the broccoli is too firm for your liking, roast it for 3 to 5 more minutes and check it again.

steps.headline: Whisk the lemon juice, remaining olive oil, shallot, salt, and pepper.
steps.description: Pour 2 teaspoons (9.9 ml) of lemon juice into a small bowl. Add 1 teaspoon (3 g) of minced shallot and the remaining 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of extra-virgin olive oil. Sprinkle salt and pepper to taste and whisk the mixture until it's combined.

steps.headline: Place the roasted broccoli in a bowl.
steps.description: Remove the sheet of roasted broccoli from the oven and transfer the florets to a large bowl.

steps.headline: Toss the roasted broccoli with the seasoning mixture.
steps.description: Pour the lemon seasoning over the florets in the bowl. Use a large spoon to stir the broccoli until it's coated.

steps.headline: Stir in the Parmesan and serve the broccoli.
steps.description: Add 2 tablespoons (10 g) of freshly grated Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese and stir the broccoli to combine it. Serve the broccoli immediately. Put the leftovers in an airtight container and refrigerate it for 3 to 5 days.

text: Roasting Basic Broccoli Preheat the oven to 425 °F (218 °C). Move the rack in the oven so it's in the center. Season the broccoli with olive oil and salt. Place 1 pound (450 g) of broccoli florets in a bowl and drizzle 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of olive oil over the florets. Sprinkle 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 g) of salt over the florets and use your hands or tongs to toss them until they're evenly coated. Spread the broccoli on a sheet. Open the the oven door and place the baking sheet in the center of the oven. Close the oven door. Roast the broccoli for 10 minutes. Spoon the seasoned broccoli on a rimmed baking sheet. Ensure that the florets are evenly spaced so they cook evenly. Roast the broccoli in the preheated oven for 10 minutes. Remove and stir the broccoli. Wear oven mitts to remove the baking sheet from the oven. Use a flat spatula to stir the broccoli and return the sheet to the oven. Roast the broccoli for 10 to 15 more minutes. Cook the broccoli until it's tender and slightly crispy on the edges. This should take another 10 to 15 minutes. You can insert a fork or knife into a floret to see if it's done. If it's tender, the fork or knife should slide right out. Serve the basic roasted broccoli. Turn off the oven and transfer the roasted broccoli to a serving dish. Add more salt and pepper according to your taste and serve the broccoli immediately. Store leftover roasted broccoli in an airtight container. Refrigerate it for 3 to 5 days. Roasting Garlic and Breadcrumb Broccoli Preheat the oven to 425 °F (218 °C) and toast the panko for 2 minutes. Get out a 9 inches (23 cm) by 13 inches (33 cm) pan and spread 1/3 cup (30 g) of panko bread crumbs in it. Once the oven is hot, put the pan in and toast the breadcrumbs for 2 minutes. Season the broccoli with olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper. Put 1 pound (450 g) of broccoli florets into a bowl and pour 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of olive oil over them. Stir in 2 cloves of minced garlic, 1/2 teaspoon (2.5 g) of kosher salt, and 1/4 teaspoon (0.5 g) of freshly ground black pepper. Stir in the toasted panko. Wear oven mitts to hold the sheet of toasted panko. Transfer the breadcrumbs into the bowl with the seasoned broccoli and stir to combine them. Transfer the broccoli to the pan. Spread the broccoli evenly in the same pan you used to toast the panko. Roast the broccoli for 8 to 10 minutes. The broccoli should become tender and slightly crunchy around the edges. If the florets are still too firm, cook them for another 2 to 5 minutes. Stir in the Parmesan and serve the broccoli. Wear oven mitts to remove the broccoli from the oven. Scatter 1/4 cup (25 g) of finely grated Parmesan or sharp Cheddar over the roasted broccoli and stir it gently before serving. Refrigerate leftover broccoli in an airtight container for 3 to 5 days. Making Lemon and Parmesan Broccoli Preheat the oven to 400 °F (204 °C) and mix the broccoli with oil, salt, and pepper. Put 1 ⁄2 pounds (680 g) of broccoli florets on a large rimmed baking sheet. Drizzle 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of the extra-virgin olive oil over the broccoli and sprinkle salt and pepper to taste. Use your hands or tongs to toss the broccoli with the seasonings. Spread the broccoli on the sheet. Ensure that the broccoli florets are in a single layer with a little space in between them. Air should be able to move between the florets so they caramelize on the edges. Roast the broccoli for 15 minutes. Open the oven door and put the baking sheet in the preheated oven. Cook the broccoli for 15 minutes so it starts to soften. Stir the broccoli. Wear oven mitts to remove the baking sheet from the oven. Stir the broccoli with a flat spatula and put the sheet back in the oven. Stirring will ensure that the broccoli cooks evenly. Roast the broccoli for 15 more minutes. Cook the broccoli until it's golden brown and tender when you poke it with a fork. If the broccoli is too firm for your liking, roast it for 3 to 5 more minutes and check it again. Whisk the lemon juice, remaining olive oil, shallot, salt, and pepper. Pour 2 teaspoons (9.9 ml) of lemon juice into a small bowl. Add 1 teaspoon (3 g) of minced shallot and the remaining 2 tablespoons (30 ml) of extra-virgin olive oil. Sprinkle salt and pepper to taste and whisk the mixture until it's combined. Place the roasted broccoli in a bowl. Remove the sheet of roasted broccoli from the oven and transfer the florets to a large bowl. Toss the roasted broccoli with the seasoning mixture. Pour the lemon seasoning over the florets in the bowl. Use a large spoon to stir the broccoli until it's coated. Stir in the Parmesan and serve the broccoli. Add 2 tablespoons (10 g) of freshly grated Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese and stir the broccoli to combine it. Serve the broccoli immediately. Put the leftovers in an airtight container and refrigerate it for 3 to 5 days.
